data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهُ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
The word مَنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From
The word وَهُوَ comes from the root ه و and is associated with the meanings: huwa = He (pronoun. masculine 3rd. sing.)

data.meanings: to will/wish. shaiun (pl. ashyaa'un) - thing/matter, affair in any way, at all, what is willed or wished, aught, any extent. In direct objective case it is often used to denote the meaning "a little", "bit", "at all". Adverbially it means "in any way", "at all".
data.sentence: The word يَشَاءُ comes from the root ش ي ا and is associated with the meanings: to will/wish. shaiun (pl. ashyaa'un) - thing/matter, affair in any way, at all, what is willed or wished, aught, any extent. In direct objective case it is often used to denote the meaning "a little", "bit", "at all". Adverbially it means "in any way", "at all".

data.meanings: mighty/potent/powerful/strong, noble/honourable/glorious, resisted/withstood, invincible, overcome (e.g. in argument), exalt, prevail, highly esteemed, precious, glory, vanity, excellent, proud and hard manner, stern.. uzza - name of an idol of the pagan Arabs regarded by them as God's daughter.. . 'Azza (prf. 3rd. m. sing. asim. V): Prevailed.. 'Azzaznaa (prf. 1st. pl. II): We strengthened.. Tu'izzu (impf. 2nd. m. pl. II): thou honour, confer honour and dignity.. 'Izzan (v. n.): source of strength.. 'Izzatun (v. n.): vain pride, false prestige or sense of self respect, might honour, power.. Al-Aziizun (act. pic. m. sing.): All-Mighty, One of the names of Allah, Unassailable, invincible, powerful in evidences and arguments, strong, mighty, heavy (with 'alaa: tell hard upon).. A'azzu (elative): more powerful, that occupies stronger and more respectable position.. A'izzatan (n. pl.): most respectable and powerful, its sing. is 'Aziiyun.
data.sentence: The word الْعَزِيزُ comes from the root ع ز ز and is associated with the meanings: mighty/potent/powerful/strong, noble/honourable/glorious, resisted/withstood, invincible, overcome (e.g. in argument), exalt, prevail, highly esteemed, precious, glory, vanity, excellent, proud and hard manner, stern.. uzza - name of an idol of the pagan Arabs regarded by them as God's daughter.. . 'Azza (prf. 3rd. m. sing. asim. V): Prevailed.. 'Azzaznaa (prf. 1st. pl. II): We strengthened.. Tu'izzu (impf. 2nd. m. pl. II): thou honour, confer honour and dignity.. 'Izzan (v. n.): source of strength.. 'Izzatun (v. n.): vain pride, false prestige or sense of self respect, might honour, power.. Al-Aziizun (act. pic. m. sing.): All-Mighty, One of the names of Allah, Unassailable, invincible, powerful in evidences and arguments, strong, mighty, heavy (with 'alaa: tell hard upon).. A'azzu (elative): more powerful, that occupies stronger and more respectable position.. A'izzatan (n. pl.): most respectable and powerful, its sing. is 'Aziiyun.

data.meanings: to provide, supply, bestow, grant. turzaqan - you both shall be supplied. rizq - bounty, gift. raziq - one who provides or supplies. razzaq -great provider/supplier.
data.sentence: The word يَرْزُقُ comes from the root ر ز ق and is associated with the meanings: to provide, supply, bestow, grant. turzaqan - you both shall be supplied. rizq - bounty, gift. raziq - one who provides or supplies. razzaq -great provider/supplier.

data.meanings: to be, become strong, prevail, be able to do, be powerful, be vigorous, be forceful. quwwatun (pl. quwan) - power, strength, vigour, resolution, firmness, determination. qawun - desert. aqwa - to stay in desert. muqwin - dwellers of desert/wilderness (it is derived from the verb qawiya which means: it became desolate or deserted).
data.sentence: The word الْقَوِيُّ comes from the root ق و ي and is associated with the meanings: to be, become strong, prevail, be able to do, be powerful, be vigorous, be forceful. quwwatun (pl. quwan) - power, strength, vigour, resolution, firmness, determination. qawun - desert. aqwa - to stay in desert. muqwin - dwellers of desert/wilderness (it is derived from the verb qawiya which means: it became desolate or deserted).

data.meanings: To be delicate, subtle, slender, graceful, courtesy, elegant, gentle, kind, fine, nice, sooth/caress, gift/present. latif n.m. - 6:103, 12:100, 22:63, 31:16, 33:34, 42:19, 67:14 talattafa vb. (V) impf. act. 18:19
data.sentence: The word لَطِيفٌ comes from the root ل ط ف and is associated with the meanings: To be delicate, subtle, slender, graceful, courtesy, elegant, gentle, kind, fine, nice, sooth/caress, gift/present. latif n.m. - 6:103, 12:100, 22:63, 31:16, 33:34, 42:19, 67:14 talattafa vb. (V) impf. act. 18:19

data.meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.
data.sentence: The word بِعِبَادِهِ comes from the root ع ب د and is associated with the meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.
